wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Woulfe (1787 – 2 July 1840) was an Irish barrister and Whig politician. He served as Solicitor-General for Ireland, 1836 and as Attorney-General for Ireland in 1838;. He was the  first Roman Catholic  to be  appointed  Chief Baron of the Irish Exchequer. He  died young,  due  to a combination of chronic ill-health and overwork.
